com.github.mrm1st3r.cards.game

Class Gameplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mrm1st3r.cards.game.Gameplay
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ThirtyOne

    public abstract class Gameplay
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class describes the general functions of a card game.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sergius Maier

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Player activePlayer
      The player whose turn it is.
      private CardValue[] cardDeckType
      The type of card deck that will be used for the game.
      private java.util.LinkedList<Card> cards
      The current deck of hidden cards left.
      private Player dealer
      The player who is dealer for this round.
      private int maxPlayerCount
      The maximum number of players in this game.
      private java.util.LinkedList<Player> playerList
      All currently connected players.

    • Field Detail

      • maxPlayerCount

        private final int maxPlayerCount
        The maximum number of players in this game. (In most cases this is the number of players who start the game)

      • playerList

        private final java.util.LinkedList<Player> playerList
        All currently connected players.

      • cards

        private java.util.LinkedList<Card> cards
        The current deck of hidden cards left.

        The type of card deck that will be used for the game.

        The player whose turn it is.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Gameplay

        public Gameplay(int pPlayerCount,
        CardValue[] pCardDeck)
        Construct a new game.
        Parameters:
        pPlayerCount - Number of players for this game
        pCardDeck - The type of card deck that is used

    • Method Detail

      • createCardDeck

        protected final void createCardDeck()
        Create a new, ordered card deck that contains all values set in cardDeckType in all four colors.

      • takeCard

        public final Card takeCard()
        Take a random card from the ordered card deck.
        Returns:
        The taken card, or null if there are no cards left on the deck

      • addPlayer

        public final boolean addPlayer(Player p)
        Add a new player to the game.
        Parameters:
        p - The player to be added
        Returns:
        true on success, false when the maximum number of players was already reached before

      • nextPlayerFor

        protected final Player nextPlayerFor(Player p)
        Get the player who is to make his turn after the given player.
        Parameters:
        p - The player whose next to search
        Returns:
        The next player

        Returns:
